message.content: We refer to the American College of Obstetricians and Gynecologists (ACOG) guidelines on antibiotic use during pregnancy for help. These guidelines state that fluoroquinolones such as moxifloxacin should be avoided in the first trimester due to the risk of potential harm to developing cartilage. Piperacillin/tazobactam is a reasonable alternative in this case. However, as a resident, it is important to discuss your concerns with your attending before making any changes to the prescribed treatment plan. Waiting to administer antibiotics until the attending is aware of the concerns is the most appropriate response in this scenario.
